blogs.title: My New Website
blogs.body: I finally pushed the first version of my website live today. It’s simple, but it feels great to see something I built from scratch out in the world. Next up: adding animations and maybe a small blog section.
blogs.author: Mario

blogs.title: Welcome Party!
blogs.body: Last night’s welcome party was a blast—music playing, food everywhere, and a whole lot of laughter. Even the shy ones joined in by the end. Definitely a night to remember!
blogs.author: Luigi

blogs.title: Web Dev Top Tips
blogs.body: Start with the fundamentals, experiment with small projects, and don’t fear debugging. Half of web development is just figuring out why something isn’t working and making it better.
blogs.author: Yoshi

blogs.title: Morning Coffee Thoughts
blogs.body: There’s something powerful about that first sip of coffee. It’s like hitting a reset button for the mind. Today’s plan: tackle tasks slowly but steadily, one sip at a time.
blogs.author: Peach

blogs.title: My Favorite Tools
blogs.body: I’ve been experimenting with new productivity tools lately. Some work wonders, some… not so much. But finding the right setup feels like discovering a superpower.
blogs.author: Toad

blogs.title: Learning Something New
blogs.body: Picked up a new course today. The start is always exciting—full of curiosity and a bit of confusion. But that’s all part of the learning adventure.
blogs.author: Bowser

blogs.title: A Walk in the Park
blogs.body: Took a long walk through the park this afternoon. The weather was perfect, and the quiet moments between the trees made the whole day feel lighter.
blogs.author: Daisy

blogs.title: Coding Late at Night
blogs.body: There’s something magical about coding at night—the silence, the focus, the sense that the whole world is sleeping while you’re building something new.
blogs.author: Wario

blogs.title: Weekend Projects
blogs.body: This weekend I decided to start a tiny side project. It’s nothing big, just a simple app idea, but working on something purely for fun feels refreshing.
blogs.author: Waluigi

blogs.title: Random Thoughts
blogs.body: Sometimes the best ideas come out of nowhere—during a walk, a shower, or while staring at the ceiling doing nothing. Creativity is strange, but wonderful.
blogs.author: Rosalina
